item.title: Scattered Spider Targeting VMware vSphere Environments
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The financially motivated group is pivoting from Active Directory to VMware vSphere environments, deploying ransomware from the hypervisor.

The post Scattered Spider Targeting VMware vSphere Environments appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Allianz Life Data Breach Impacts Most of 1.4 Million US Customers
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Allianz subsidiary said the information of customers, financial professionals and employees was compromised as a result of a hack.

The post Allianz Life Data Breach Impacts Most of 1.4 Million US Customers appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: BlackSuit Ransomware Group Transitioning to ‘Chaos’ Amid Leak Site Seizure
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The emerging Chaos ransomware appears to be a rebranding of BlackSuit, which had its leak site seized by law enforcement.

The post BlackSuit Ransomware Group Transitioning to ‘Chaos’ Amid Leak Site Seizure appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Flaw Allowing Website Takeover Found in WordPress Plugin With 400k Installations
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The Post SMTP email delivery WordPress plugin is affected by a critical vulnerability and half of websites using it remain unpatched.

The post Flaw Allowing Website Takeover Found in WordPress Plugin With 400k Installations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: $30k Google Cloud Build Flaw, Louis Vuitton Breach Update, Attack Surface Growth
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Google Cloud Build vulnerability earns researcher big bounty, more countries hit by Louis Vuitton data breach, organizations’ attack surface is increasing. 

The post In Other News: $30k Google Cloud Build Flaw, Louis Vuitton Breach Update, Attack Surface Growth appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Mitel Patches Critical Flaw in Enterprise Communication Platform
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
An authentication bypass vulnerability in Mitel MiVoice MX-ONE could allow attackers to access user or admin accounts on the system.

The post Mitel Patches Critical Flaw in Enterprise Communication Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Sophisticated Koske Linux Malware Developed With AI Aid
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
The Koske Linux malware shows how cybercriminals can use AI for payload development, persistence, and adaptivity.

The post Sophisticated Koske Linux Malware Developed With AI Aid appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: UK Student Sentenced to Prison for Selling Phishing Kits
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Ollie Holman was sentenced to prison for selling over 1,000 phishing kits that caused estimated losses of over $134 million.

The post UK Student Sentenced to Prison for Selling Phishing Kits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chinese Spies Target Networking and Virtualization Flaws to Breach Isolated Environments
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Chinese cyberespionage group Fire Ant is targeting virtualization and networking infrastructure to access isolated environments.

The post Chinese Spies Target Networking and Virtualization Flaws to Breach Isolated Environments appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: No Patch for Flaw Exposing Hundreds of LG Cameras to Remote Hacking
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
LG Innotek LNV5110R security cameras are affected by a vulnerability that can be exploited for unauthenticated remote code execution.

The post No Patch for Flaw Exposing Hundreds of LG Cameras to Remote Hacking appeared first on SecurityWeek.
